Token Kantei Hiketsu doesn't say much about Kiyomune. On the Ni=F4 it  
has=
 this to say in part;

	"Tachi no sugata haba semaku, kasane atsushi, (shod=
ai Kiyozane) ooku  
wa sugu-ha ni yakutari, ni dai-mei wa midare ha ni shit=
e nie komaka  
ni, boshi maruku, kaeri fukaku, hi o kakitaru mono ooshi. na=
kago wa  
mijikaku, mune wa koniku ni shite ha no ho mo onaji, katayama gat=
a  
nari..."
	Among the images in this section it shows a handrawn oshigata=
 of  
Kiyomune, and though it is far from photographic it shows that his  
=
yasuri-mei was katte-sagari, the mune on his nakago was kaku and he  
used =
kurijiri instead of the more characteristic katayama.
	Tsunaishi in Nihonto=
 no Kantei to Kansho breaks it down into Ko-Ni=F4  
and Sue Ni=F4 school an=
d has a good two pages of info, however Kiyomune  
is not mentioned and doe=
s not appear in his "family tree" for this  
school.
	I have added two scan=
s to my new folder, Nihontoryu in the photos  
section along with some phot=
os of sutff I saw in Japan on a recent  
trip but unrelated to this or any =
other thread...
-t

PS check the English edition of Token Bijutsu issues 13=
 and 42 for  
info on Kiyozane
